author: TNN
description: The Karnataka government has reinstated four police officers, including the former Bengaluru City police commissioner, who were suspended following the deadly stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium in June. Disciplinary proceedings are still pending against the reinstated officers, and further action will depend on the outcome of these proceedings. However, the additional commissioner of police (west) remains suspended as his case is pending in high court.
title: 4 Karnataka cops suspended for stampede reinstated

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 6.3 magnitude earthquake strikes West Bengal

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has overturned the Calcutta High Court's stay on West Bengal's revised OBC sub-group list, which includes 80 Muslim sub-groups. The court emphasized that the Executive branch can notify such lists without needing legislation, citing a previous nine-judge bench ruling. The High Court's stay was deemed erroneous, and the case may be reassigned to a special bench for review.
title: Apex court lifts HC stay on West Bengal OBC list

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Disney has released the first trailer for James Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash,' showcasing new tribes and escalating conflict on Pandora. Jake Sully's family unites with the Metkayina to battle Varang and her fire-wielding Ash People, allied with Quaritch. Cameron promises a longer, emotionally intense film, with the movie scheduled to release on December 19, 2025.
title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ first official trailer out

author: DEBASIS KONAR
description: The Election Commission has released the 2002 special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bengal, covering 109 assembly segments across 11 districts. This move is seen as a precursor to a new SIR rollout in the state. Simultaneously, the CEO's office is addressing complaints of false voters, summoning officials for clarification. These actions coincide with ongoing training for booth level officers.
title: Bengal polls: EC releases 2002 SIR data; signals rolls revision

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Amidst recent setbacks, Boeing is poised to benefit from trade deals orchestrated by US President Donald Trump. These agreements are expected to generate new aircraft orders, potentially aiding Boeing's recovery. However, experts question the extent of Trump's influence, suggesting that many orders would have materialized regardless.
title: Boeing may be benefitting big from Donald Trump's trade war despite regulatory hurdles

author: TNN
title: Cong's can't trust own EAM, it trusts some other country: Amit Shah

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Deion Sanders is facing health issues. Karrueche Tran is reportedly offering support. Dating rumors are circulating online. They were spotted dining together earlier this year. Karrueche is an Emmy-winning actress. She is known for her roles in Claws and The Bay. Deion's ex-wife reposted his message. His son posted a video from the hospital.
title: Deion Sanders & Karrueche Tran: Dating rumours swirl — what we know so far

author: KRISHNA CHOUDHURY
description: A junior resident doctor at Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial Medical College in Meerut has been suspended following allegations of negligence. The doctor allegedly failed to attend to a 30-year-old accident victim, Sunil Kumar, who later died from his injuries while waiting for treatment. An investigation has been launched into the incident after a video surfaced showing the doctor seemingly asleep while Kumar's family pleaded for help.
title: Doctor asleep, man 'bleeds to death' in Meerut hospital

author: SOMESWAR BORAL AND DWAIPAYAN GHOSH
description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the Election Commission of acting as a "BJP agent" to implement NRC during a rally in Bolpur. She challenged the poll body to delete any genuine Bengal voter and cautioned booth level officers against harassing people, reminding them of their state government employment.
title: EC has become a BJP agent to implement NRC: Mamata Banerjee

author: PATHIKRIT CHAKRABORTY
title: ED gets five-day custodial remand of Chhangur Baba

author: MS NAWAZ
description: A stampede near the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar resulted in eight fatalities and numerous injuries. Initial rescue efforts were hampered by a rumour of electric current running through the fallen pilgrims, causing hesitation among bystanders. Constable Sanjay Kapoor and local shopkeepers initiated rescues, overcoming the fear.
title: Fear of electrocution initially stalled rescue op at Mansa Devi temple

author: TNN
description: India's education policy is undergoing a significant shift, integrating traditional knowledge systems into mainstream research. The 'Setubandha Vidwan Yojana' enables gurukul scholars without formal degrees to pursue research at IITs with generous fellowships. This initiative aims to bridge ancient wisdom with modern science, fostering interdisciplinary studies and empowering traditional scholars to contribute to national progress.
title: Government throws open IITs for students from gurukuls

author: TNN
description: Just before the Operation Sindoor debate, the killing of three alleged terrorists near Srinagar, including Suleiman, the suspected mastermind of the Pahalgam massacre, seemingly deflated the opposition's planned criticism of the government's counterterrorism efforts. Despite this development, SP's Ramashankar Rajbhar questioned the delay in arresting those responsible for the Pahalgam attack, even as BJP's Baijyant Panda celebrated the news of Suleiman's death during Operation Mahadev.
title: Killing of terrorist who led Pahalgam strike blunts opposition's attack in House

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Evgeny Kuznetsov is eyeing a return to the NHL for the 2025-26 season. After a strong KHL stint, the veteran center is now one of the top unsigned free agents. We explore three potential NHL destinations, the Boston Bruins, Vancouver Canucks, and Colorado Avalanche. And that could benefit from his experience, skill, and potential resurgence.
title: Kuznetsov: Eyes NHL return after KHL exit; Bruins, Canucks & Avalanche linked to star

author: TNN
description: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar defended India's global outreach following the Pahalgam attack, asserting overwhelming international support and dismissing claims of policy failure. He highlighted backing from Quad, Brics, and the UNSC, emphasizing India's right to defend against cross-border terrorism. Jaishankar also criticized past Congress actions and defended his China visit for de-escalation talks.
title: Monsoon session: At no stage of talks with US was trade tied to Sindoor, says EAM - details

author: TOI NEWS DESK

author: TNN
description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has assured social security for migrant workers willing to return to the state, promising ration cards, health cards, and jobs. She directed officials to formulate a scheme for their return by train, emphasizing that Bengal will provide for its people. Banerjee also criticized the alleged persecution of Bengalis in other states and defended the skills of Bengali workers.
title: No need to stay in Maha, UP or Raj, Mamata tells migrants

author: TNN
description: A political firestorm has erupted over P. Chidambaram's suggestion that the Pahalgam attackers might be homegrown, sparking sharp criticism from BJP leaders. They accuse Congress of echoing Pakistan's narrative and undermining the army's efforts. Chidambaram defends his statement, claiming it was taken out of context and misrepresented by trolls seeking to spread misinformation.
title: Pahalgam massacre: 'Homegrown' ultras may be involved, says P Chidambaram, sparks row

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti urged the Centre to abandon its security-centric approach and embrace dialogue, asserting PM Modi could resolve the Kashmir issue. She criticized the revocation of Article 370 for deepening alienation, not bringing peace. Defending PDP's alliance with BJP in 2015, she emphasized the party's commitment to dialogue and a peaceful J&K integrated with India through mutual respect.
title: PM Modi can rewrite J&K’s history with dialogue: Mehbooba Mufti

author: TNN
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh defended Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, stating its objective was to punish Pakistan for proxy terrorism by eliminating terror nurseries, and it was paused after achieving desired results, not due to US pressure. The opposition criticized the government for halting the operation and demanded accountability for security lapses in Pahalgam and clarification on downed Indian jets, questioning the operation's success and the delay in reclaiming PoK.
title: Rajnath Singh: Operation Sindoor achieved objective, was then 'paused'

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar and EPIC for voter authentication during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that the SIR should focus on broad inclusion rather than exclusion. While rejecting a stay on the SIR, the court agreed to daily hearings for a swift resolution.
title: SIR in Bihar: Accept Aadhaar along with voter ID, SC tells EC

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: The Congress party in J&K has announced it will observe August 5th as a 'Black Day' to mark six years since the abrogation of Article 370 and the downgrading of the state. JKPCC president Tariq Hameed Karra stated that peaceful sit-in protests will be held on August 5th, followed by hunger strikes from August 9th to 20th, excluding August 15th and 16th.
title: Statehood demand: Congress announces August 5 as Black day in J&K

author: CHETHAN KUMAR
description: The Nasa-Isro Synthetic Aperture Radar (Nisar) satellite is scheduled to launch on July 30 aboard the GSLV-F16 rocket from Sriharikota. Following launch, a meticulous deployment sequence will unfold over several weeks, including the deployment of a massive 12-meter radar antenna. After a 90-day commissioning phase, Nisar will commence its science operations, capturing crucial data on Earth's surface changes using its L-band and S-band frequencies.
title: TOI explains: How Nisar was built - why it’ll take 90 days before any data comes in

author: AVIJIT GHOSH
description: An old controversy resurfaced as parallels are drawn to the Stokes-Jadeja incident. In the 1983 Bangalore Test, Pakistan's captain Zaheer Abbas controversially left the field, halting play for nearly half an hour and leaving Sunil Gavaskar stranded. Gavaskar, battling illness, eventually completed his century amidst the drama, with teammates and officials questioning Zaheer's sportsmanship.
title: When Pakistan Test team left the ground leaving Gavaskar stranded at 86

While sporadic clashes persisted, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet thanked Trump for his support.

description: Ravichandran Ashwin has advised Shubman Gill to reconsider his bowling strategies before the crucial fifth Test against England at The Oval. Ashwin emphasized that winning Test matches requires a focus on bowlers who can take wickets, rather than relying solely on batting depth.
title: 'Make that call': Ashwin urges Gill to take bold decision for Oval decider

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Shashi Tharoor's silence on Operation Sindoor sparks debate. Despite leading a delegation after the Pahalgam attack, he declined to speak on the issue in Parliament. Gaurav Gogoi and K Suresh approached him, but Tharoor preferred discussing the Indian Ports Bill, 2025. His endorsement of the government's actions contrasts with the Congress party's stance.
title: Monsoon session: Was Tharoor offered a chance to speak on Op Sindoor? What we know

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Stephen Curry, following the NBA tradition of seeking wisdom from influential figures, uniquely reached out to former U.S. President Barack Obama. Curry values Obama's perspective and appreciates his support, both on and off the court. Their connection extends to collaborations with Michelle Obama, highlighting a deep and meaningful partnership beyond basketball.
title: NBA legend Stephen Curry admitted seeking words of advice from Barack Obama

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Op Mahadev: 3 terrorists killed after intense gunfight with security forces; operation still under way

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In Parliament, Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi challenged Defence Minister Rajnath Singh regarding the Pahalgam attack, questioning the government's failure to prevent it. Gogoi highlighted unanswered questions about the attack, which claimed 22 lives, and criticized the government's internal security measures.
title: Op Sindoor: Gogoi leads oppn charge against govt in LS; asks ‘how terrorists reached Pahalgam?’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed Parliament regarding Operation Sindoor, the retaliatory strike following the Pahalgam attack. He confirmed the operation successfully targeted terrorist infrastructure, eliminating over 100 individuals, and was paused after achieving its objectives, dismissing claims of external pressure. Singh highlighted India's effective defense systems in thwarting Pakistan's subsequent large-scale attack, ensuring no damage to Indian assets.
title: 'Op Sindoor to resume if ... ': Rajnath tells LS how strikes rattled Pak; dismisses 'pressure' charge

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. The operation, dubbed "Operation Mahadev," follows reports linking the terrorists to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, where numerous tourists and a local resident were killed.
title: Operation Mahadev: 3 terrorists killed in Srinagar; What we know so far

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, is a box office success, nearing Rs 250 crore after a strong second weekend. The film's emotional content and music have resonated with audiences, outperforming major releases. While weekday earnings may dip, 'Saiyaara' aims for Rs 275-300 crore, facing competition from upcoming releases.
title: ‘Saiyaara’ BO collection: Mohit Suri’s film nears Rs 250 cr mark

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravichandran Ashwin has refuted a fabricated quote circulating online, falsely attributing a controversial statement to him regarding India-Pakistan matches in the World Championship of Legends (WCL) and the Asia Cup. The fake post alleged Ashwin linked financial interest to the cancellation of the WCL match and the continuation of the Asia Cup fixture.
title: ‘Shame on those who spread this’: Ashwin dismisses 'fake news’ on India vs Pakistan

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami defended India's oil imports from Russia, highlighting the nation's position as the third-largest energy consumer importing over 80% of its needs. He questioned the feasibility of halting the economy and pointed out the hypocrisy of Western nations buying other resources from countries they restrict India from trading with.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: TCS layoffs: India's IT sector is facing turbulence as TCS, the nation's largest IT firm, announces unprecedented layoffs impacting 2% of its workforce, primarily in middle to senior roles. CEO K Krithivasan cites skill mismatches, not AI, as the reason for this 'difficult decision.
title: TCS layoffs ‘biggest ever’: AI not to blame for ‘difficult’ decision?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a stunning upset, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched the FIDE Women’s World Cup title, defeating Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks. This victory not only secured her the World Cup but also earned her final Grandmaster norm, making her the fourth Indian woman to achieve the prestigious GM title.
title: Tears of joy! Divya Deshmukh breaks down after winning FIDE Women's World Cup - Watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Thailand shooting: Gunman attacks crowd in Bangkok market, then kills self; 6 dead

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed the Lok Sabha. He criticized the opposition's line of questioning regarding Operation Sindoor. Singh stated their questions did not reflect national sentiment. He emphasized the success of the operation. He confirmed no Indian soldiers were harmed. Singh urged focus on national security. He cautioned against distracting from the morale of the armed forces.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Yantai Penglai International Airport in China has been declared the world’s most beautiful airport of 2025 by Prix Versailles awards, with its Terminal 2 standing out for its coastal-inspired design and thoughtful architecture. The list also includes airports from France, Japan, and the United States, each recognized for unique design elements and sustainability efforts.
title: Top 6 world's most beautiful airports: See who tops list

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A power outage and generator failure plunged Ballia district hospital's emergency room into darkness, forcing medical staff to treat patients under torchlight. The 45-minute blackout occurred on Friday evening, prompting a swift response from health officials. Additional inverters have been installed to prevent future incidents and improve the system's efficiency.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's bowlers faced criticism after struggling to match England's intensity in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, leading to a significant first-innings deficit. Despite this setback, Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's resilient centuries in the second innings enabled India to secure a draw, marking their first at the venue in 35 years. England now leads the series 2-1.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Divya Deshmukh, a 19-year-old chess prodigy, achieved a stunning victory at the FIDE Women’s World Cup, defeating Koneru Humpy in a thrilling tie-break. This triumph not only secured her the championship but also earned her the coveted Grandmaster title, making her India's fourth woman to reach this milestone.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The drawn fourth Test between India and England witnessed heated debate after Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar refused an early draw offer, frustrating England captain Ben Stokes. Dinesh Karthik questioned England's sportsmanship, while Michael Vaughan supported India's decision to allow their batsmen to pursue centuries. With the series at 2-1, the controversy adds fuel to the highly anticipated Oval Test.
title: 'What’s with the English?' — Karthik, Vaughan weigh in on handshake drama

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) faces objections from IT employee organizations over its plan to reduce staff by approximately 12,000, impacting middle and senior positions. Unions deem the dismissals unlawful, advising employees to resist resignation pressures.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Do whatever you can': Mirzapur police officer refuses to pay, threatens shopkeeper

author: BHARAT KHANNA
description: In a shocking incident near Patiala, Malkeet Singh allegedly murdered his son, Jagpal, following a heated argument over a pedestal fan. The dispute, which occurred on Jagpal's son's birthday, escalated when Jagpal asked his father to switch off the fan. Malkeet, reportedly intoxicated, attacked Jagpal with a farming tool while he slept.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A viral video shows unreserved passengers flooding an AC coach on the Sikkim Mahananda Express at Katihar station, sparking outrage and questions about railway management. The incident, captured in a video, highlights concerns about overcrowding and passenger safety in reserved compartments. Indian Railways has responded by requesting details and escalating the issue to the Katihar division.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Barack Obama has called for immediate action to prevent starvation in Gaza, emphasizing the urgent need for aid access. While Israel announced a "tactical pause," Trump accused Hamas of diverting aid, a claim disputed by the Israeli military. Netanyahu defended Israel's aid efforts, accusing the UN of spreading falsehoods regarding humanitarian access.
title: 'Aid must be permitted to reach people': Obama voices concern over Gaza

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticized the government's handling of the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, citing a lack of transparency. He questioned the government's silence on key details, including the attackers' identity and the NIA's investigation progress. Chidambaram speculated the government might be concealing tactical errors and losses.
title: Chidambaram on Pahalgam attack: 'Why assume terrorists came from Pak?'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Yogendra Yadav criticized the Bihar government after a residence certificate was issued to a dog named 'Dog Babu' in Patna. Yadav highlighted the absurdity, noting that this certificate is being accepted under SIR while genuine Aadhaar and ration cards are being questioned.

description: The drawn fourth Test at Old Trafford was filled with drama, including Ben Stokes' appeal for an early draw and visible tension. The series remains 2-1 in England's favor, setting the stage for a high-stakes final Test at The Oval.

description: India showcased resilience, securing a draw against England in the fourth Test after batting for 143 overs. description: Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, and Shubman Gill's centuries powered India to a morale-boosting draw in the fourth Test against England. The match concluded with handshakes and reflections on valuable learnings.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Old Trafford's reputation as a draw specialist solidified as the India-England Test ended in a stalemate, marking the fifth consecutive drawn first-class match at the venue this season. Ben Stokes and Joe Root achieved individual milestones amidst the drawn Test.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's batting prowess shone brightly in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, securing a draw in the fourth Test at Old Trafford and rewriting record books. Washington Sundar's century contributed to India equaling their record of 11 centuries in a series, matching their 1978-79 feat against West Indies. The team also set a new record with seven 350-plus totals, surpassing Australia's previous best.
title: Indian team breaks multiple records — most centuries, 350+ totals and more

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: All-rounder Washington Sundar's maiden Test century spurred India to a draw against England at Old Trafford. Following Gautam Gambhir's message to 'fight for the entire day,' Sundar's unbeaten 101, coupled with Ravindra Jadeja's century, forged a 203-run partnership. India, initially struggling, recovered to 425/4, keeping the series alive at 2-1.
title: 'Just fight ...': Washington reveals Gambhir's stirring final-day message

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor remained silent on 'Operation Sindoor' ahead of a crucial Lok Sabha debate, fueling speculation about his party's stance. Tasked by the Centre to represent India's counterterrorism efforts post-Pahalgam attack, Tharoor's support for the operation, which targeted terror camps in Pakistan, has caused internal friction within the Congress.

This moment highlighted Messi's global popularity, blending his sporting fame into American pop culture.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress MP Manickam Tagore criticized Prime Minister Modi's Chola tribute, alleging intelligence failures and comparing Modi's foreign policy unfavorably to the Chola empire's. Tagore accused Modi of succumbing to foreign pressure and challenged him to address these issues in Parliament. Modi, celebrating Rajendra Chola I's legacy, highlighted the Chola era's cultural and strategic achievements, emphasizing the repatriation of looted artifacts.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes AI is the "greatest technology equaliser," democratising programming and fostering creativity. He predicts AI will generate more millionaires in the next five years than the internet did in twenty. Huang also cautioned that individuals and nations must embrace AI to remain competitive, envisioning a future where every country operates both physical and digital factories.
title: Nvidia CEO Huang predicts: AI will create more millionaires in five years

author: TOI
description: Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, implicated in Renukaswamy's murder case, has returned to Bengaluru from Thailand. He was granted court permission to travel for the shooting of his film 'Devil'. Darshan, along with his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda and fifteen others, were previously arrested in connection with the murder that occurred in June last year.

description: Rishabh Pant has been ruled out of the final Test against England due to a foot fracture sustained during the fourth Test, where he bravely batted through the pain to score a half-century. author: TOI SPORTS DESK

The incident occurred during the fourth Test in Manchester. India and England eventually shook hands.

description: A dispute surrounds the Election Commission's revision of voter lists in Bihar. Opposition parties allege voter suppression. They have taken the matter to the Supreme Court. The revision may extend nationwide.

description: Tata Consultancy Services plans to reduce its workforce by approximately 12,000 employees, representing 2% of its global staff, as part of a strategic shift towards automation and AI readiness. author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Google acknowledged its Android Earthquake Alerts system's failure to issue critical warnings before the devastating 2023 Turkey earthquake, which resulted in over 55,000 deaths. The system underestimated the quake's magnitude, leading to insufficient "Take Action" alerts. This revelation has sparked concerns about over-reliance on Google's alerts and the need for transparent performance assessments.
title: Turkey earthquake: Did Google fail to alert millions?

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Get ready for a celestial treat. Two meteor showers, Southern Delta Aquariids and Alpha Capricornids, will peak together. The event is expected on July 29–30, 2025. Skywatchers can see up to 25 meteors per hour. The Southern Hemisphere will have the best view. A moonless sky will ensure great visibility. Do not miss this natural light show.
title: Twin meteor showers to light up July 29–30 skies with 25 shooting stars an hour

description: Vanessa Bryant showed her support for Russell Wilson's family by commenting on Ciara's Instagram post, which featured the family cheering Wilson at training camp. Their families share a close friendship, celebrating milestones and vacations together.

description: India's remarkable draw at Old Trafford against England not only kept the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy hopes alive but also slightly bolstered their position in the World Test Championship (WTC) 2025-27 standings. author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Saumya Kashyap, the wife of a Uttar Pradesh police constable, tragically died by suicide, leaving behind an Instagram video accusing her in-laws of severe harassment. She alleged they pressured her husband to remarry and that her brother-in-law threatened her life. Authorities were alerted after the video surfaced, and an investigation is underway following the notification of Saumya's family.

description: A tragic accident occurred near Jagera bridge in Maloud as a pickup truck carrying devotees returning from Naina Devi temple plunged into the Sirhind Canal. The incident resulted in the death of four individuals, including two children, and left three others missing.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A shocking video from Cincinnati shows a man and woman violently attacked during a downtown brawl. The man was chased, beaten, and stomped on, while the woman was punched unconscious when she tried to help. Police are investigating the incident, sparked by a possible exchange of racial slurs.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill defended Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's pursuit of centuries on Day 5 of the drawn fourth Test against England. Gill emphasised that both deserved their hundreds after their impressive partnership rescued India from a precarious position. Despite England's frustration and Ben Stokes's sarcastic remarks, Jadeja and Sundar remained composed, guiding India to a respectable draw.

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: Justice Yashwant Varma, facing a Parliament removal motion over cash found at his residence, has anonymously petitioned the Supreme Court to quash the inquiry report and the former CJI's recommendation for his removal. The Supreme Court is set to hear his plea, alongside another petition seeking an FIR against him.
title: Cash-in-kothi controversy: Judge Varma hides identity, is ‘XXX’ in his SC petition - details

description: Russell Wilson joins the New York Giants. Ciara grabs attention at training camp. She wore stylish denim shorts and a custom Wilson jersey. The couple's fashion sense is a game-changer. Baby Amora resembles her dad.

author: PRADEEP THAKUR
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating Anil Ambani's Reliance group for allegedly diverting ₹12,000 crore from Reliance Home Finance Ltd (RHFL) to related entities. Assisted by multiple agencies, the ED is scrutinizing transactions involving 22 individuals and 60 companies. A SEBI report highlights alleged fund laundering, with RHFL writing off ₹7,000 crore in loans to Anil Ambani linked entities.
title: ED probes Anil’s RHFL for writing off Rs 7k cr loans to group firms

author: TNN
description: Amid global economic uncertainty and fluctuating FDI inflows, the Indian government is actively targeting specific sectors like electronics, footwear, chemicals, medical devices, toys, and EVs to attract foreign investment. Efforts include leveraging production-linked incentive schemes and building resilient supply chains to reduce reliance on China.
title: Government identifies key sectors to attract foreign investors

author: TNN
description: PM Modi lauded India's growing space capabilities, highlighting Group Captain Shukla's ISS journey and the surge in space startups to over 200. He noted the Chandrayaan-3 mission sparked curiosity among children, boosting participation in science innovation programs. Modi also encouraged ideas for celebrating the upcoming National Space Day on August 23.
title: India growing by leaps and bounds in space sector: PM Modi

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court addressed a complex matrimonial situation involving Indian Ambassador Thongkomang Armstrong Changsan, who remarried after a customary divorce deemed invalid by the Gauhati High Court. The court showed no sympathy for Changsan, whose first marriage, solemnized in a church, was improperly dissolved by village elders.
title: India's ambassador to Cuba ends up with 2 wives, SC seeks solution

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravindra Jadeja has matched Sir Garfield Sobers' 1966 record, achieving five 50+ scores at No.6 or lower in a Test series in England. His unbeaten 107 in the fourth Test helped India secure a draw. Jadeja's consistent performance places him alongside Sobers in elite lists, with over 1000 runs and 30+ wickets in England.
title: Jadeja rewrites Test history, equals Sobers' 59-year-old record in England

author: TNN
description: Prime Minister Modi, ahead of a crucial parliamentary debate on the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, asserted India's firm stance against terrorism. Speaking in Tamil Nadu, Modi emphasized that the precision strikes in Pakistan sent a clear message: terrorists have no safe havens. He highlighted the operation's role in fostering national self-confidence.
title: New self-confidence in India post Sindoor: PM Modi before Parliament debate

author: NEEL KAMAL
description: In Punjab, resistance to the AAP government's land-pooling policy is uniting fragmented farm organizations and individual farmers, reigniting farm struggles. Despite government assurances, farmers fear losing land under the scheme, which aims to pool over 40,000 acres for urban development, offering developed plots in exchange.
title: Opposition to Punjab's land-pooling policy brings together farmers

author: DEEPAK KARTHIK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the Chola dynasty's historical and cultural significance, announcing plans to erect statues of Raja Raja Chola and Rajendra Chola in Tamil Nadu. PM Modi commemorated Rajendra Chola I's birth anniversary at the Brihadisvara temple, highlighting the Cholas' contributions to Shaivism, temple architecture, and strategic advancements.
title: PM Modi hails Chola legacy, unveils statue plan in TN

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, continues its successful run at the box office, earning Rs. 247.25 crore in India after 10 days. The film witnessed a significant jump in collections during its second weekend, reaching Rs. 44.5 crore in two days. 'Saiyaara' has become the second-highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025, surpassing 'Housefull 5'.
title: ‘Saiyaara’ BO collection: Mohit Suri’s film earns Rs 247.25 crore; Ahaan & Aneet shine

author: VEENA MANI AND REEBA ZACHARIAH
description: TCS, India's largest IT firm, will lay off 12,261 employees, about 2% of its workforce, due to AI disruptions and uncertain business demand. This significant restructuring aims to transform TCS into a future-ready organization. The job cuts primarily affect mid-level and senior executives, reflecting a strategic shift towards embracing AI and automation.
title: TCS to axe 12,000 jobs; IT giant’s biggest layoff ever

author: TNN
description: Shashi Tharoor is unlikely to participate in the Lok Sabha debate on the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Sources indicate that neither Tharoor nor the Congress party has expressed interest in his involvement. While Rahul Gandhi is a potential initiator, he might delegate to Gaurav Gogoi, as seen previously.
title: Tharoor unlikely to speak on debate on Pahalgam attack, Op Sindoor issues in LS

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: JP Morgan downgraded Bajaj Finance, while Morgan Stanley remained overweight on SBI Life Insurance after positive quarterly results. Macquarie lowered Nestle's target price due to missed estimates and growth concerns. Conversely, Investec upgraded Torrent Pharma following its acquisition of JB Chemicals. Axis Capital maintained a reduce rating on Canara Bank, citing NIM pressure.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for July 28, 2025 - check list

author: PATHIKRIT CHAKRABORTY
description: In Barabanki district, a tragic incident occurred outside the Awshaneshwar Mahadev temple, resulting in the electrocution of two devotees and injuries to several others. The incident happened when they came into contact with an electrified iron pipe and tin shed erected for monsoon shelter. Authorities are investigating the cause, suspecting faulty wiring or leakage.
title: Two devotees electrocuted outside Awshaneshwar temple in Barabanki

author: TNN
description: Congress has criticized BJP's decision to prioritize the Lok Sabha notice regarding Justice Yashwant Varma over the Rajya Sabha notice, alleging it stems from insecurity and a desire to control the narrative. Abhishek Singhvi accused the government of "illegality" and suggested former RS chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar's actions on the Varma issue led to his removal. Singhvi also alleged BJP MPs signed a blank paper, potentially an impeachment notice against Dhankhar.
title: Varma row: Ignoring RS notice illegal, says Congress; 'petty mindset'

author: TNN
description: In Balrampur's Pachpedwa, a hospital staff member, Yogesh Pandey, has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman patient after sedating her at a private hospital. Police acted swiftly, apprehending Pandey within 48 hours following a tip-off. The incident occurred on July 25 when the accused, a nursing staff, allegedly sedated and assaulted the woman.
title: UP hospital staff sedates patient and rapes her during night shift

author: TNN
description: Lucknow police have filed a First Information Report (FIR) against Maulana Sajid Rashidi following a complaint by Pravesh Yadav. The complaint alleges that Rashidi made offensive and misogynistic comments against Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav on television and public platforms.
title: 'Misogynistic ': 'Cleric' booked for slurs against Dimple Yadav

author: IP SINGH
description: A tragic oxygen plant malfunction at Jalandhar's Civil Hospital led to the deaths of three patients on ventilators. The fatalities occurred within a 35-minute span, prompting a high-level inquiry. While the medical superintendent acknowledged the fault and cited backup systems, a nine-member committee will investigate potential negligence. The victims included a teenager, a recovering addict, and a tuberculosis patient.
title: Three patients on ventilators die amid fault in Jalandhar civil hospital oxygen plant

author: TNN
title: Not just bricks & stones: PM Modi lauds defiance legacy of Bundelkhand forts

author: AJAY TOMAR
description: Hyderabad police uncovered a surrogacy scam at Universal Srushti Fertility Centre, arresting eight individuals, including Dr. Athaluri Namratha, for allegedly selling infants to couples under the guise of IVF. The clinic, operating without a valid license since 2021, deceived a couple who paid Rs 35 lakh, providing them with a baby unrelated to them.
title: Bought for Rs 90,000, sold as IVF baby for Rs 35 lakh; how clinic gave away newborns

author: P NAVEEN
description: In Gwalior, a 28-year-old man, Mukesh Ahirwar, distraught after his wife left following a quarrel, attempted suicide by jumping from a railway overbridge. He survived the 35-foot fall with minor injuries, thanks to the absence of train movement. After receiving treatment and counseling, he was discharged and handed over to his family for support.
title: Heartbroken man jumps off 35-ft bridge after wife leaves, survives

author: ASHISH CHAUHAN
description: A high-profile federal crackdown in the US has led to the indictment of nine Gujarati men for allegedly running a multi-million-dollar illegal gambling operation across six Missouri locations. Disguised as skill game arcades, the businesses reportedly grossed over $9.5 million between 2022 and 2025.
title: Nine from Gujarat indicted in US for running $9.5m illegal gambling biz

author: TNN
description: In Rajkot, a 12-year-old girl was allegedly molested and raped by her father over six months, according to police reports. The mother filed a complaint, leading to charges under the BNS Act and Pocso Act. The accused, a Nepalese security guard, fled after his wife discovered the abuse on July 25. Police are currently searching for him using various methods.
title: Rajkot: Daughter, 12, raped by father over 6 months
